title: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message
description: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has a confusing message.
OB: When invoking the New Java Package, the message 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' appears at the top, even though the package name field is empty. This message is unclear and it is not clear whether it is an error or a warning. It is also suggested that if it is an error, it should be displayed in red with an error icon.
EB: The message 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' should not appear when the package name field is empty and the 'Finish' button should be disabled.
SR: 1. Open the New Java Package wizard. 2. Leave the package name field empty. 3. Check if the message 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' appears at the top. 4. Verify if the 'Finish' button is enabled.
